item.description:
When setting a hike, I like to give options to get a feel for what the group is into (and to make things complicated - haha). This gathering's two options are hiking Killington or hiking Pico... but both end with a stop at the Long Trail Brewery! Here is the relevant information: http://www.vtstateparks.com/pdfs/coolidge_hiking.pdf.

The Killington route is the Bucklin Trail (#7). At 3.4 mi., it is the longer walk, but you get the broader views at the peak.

The Pico route is the Sherburne Pass Trail (#4). 2.9 mi., all trail walking, and probably quicker to access for most folks (since the head is on Rt. 4, it is probably 20 minutes less drive time than the Bucklin Trail). My preference is Pico because of lesser crowds, but I am interested to do either!

Hopefully you already know Long Trail... but if not, you will! :)

group.name: Lebanon/White River Junction Hiking Meetup Group

item.name: Hike Killington & Hit Long Trail Brewery (Sun., 9/2)
